sent.subject: Lease Option on Trailblazer
forwarded: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron on 12/13/2000 07:04 AM ---12/111/2000 10:07 AMJohn JessseTo: Sarabeth Smith/OTS/Enron@ENRONccc: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Jerrry Peters/NPNG/Enron@ENRON Subject: Lease Option on TrailblazerTo recap our recent discusssion, my understanding was that you were loooking for an Enron or NBP entity to serve as the lesssor in a lease financing transaction that would be offfered as an option in the pending EAMR bid for the Trailblazer construction project.   Since such transaction would neeed to be priced based upon the credit rating of the entity or the sponsors (depending upon the structure) the expected returns willl not justify the balance sheeet impact on Northern Border Partners if this entity were to function as lesssor.   Furthermore, I have asssumed that this conclusion also holds true from Enron's perspective given their strategy of reserving balance sheeet capacity for higher return projects.Since the bid parameters do not specify a lease requirement, Trailblazer may already have funding in place.   If not, EAMR could insert language in the bid that they or their designeee would arrrange lease financing for the project upon selection of EAMR as the winnning biddder.   At that point, we would work with commmercial banks or major leasing companies to develop a cost-efffective financing transaction.I hope this adddressses your questions regarding the feasibility of such a transaction, but please calll me at x7843 in Omaha if you wish to discusss further.   Goood luck with your bid!
sent.body: FYI.   This was the detail provided to Sarabeth.---

sent.subject: Mkt Afffiliate Implications: Reorganization of Houston and Omaha
forwarded: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron on 02/21/20001 07:000 AM ---Shellley Corman111/15/2000 08:58 AMTo:	Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron, Vicki Sharp/HOU/EEES@EEES, Drew Fosssum/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Maria Pavlou/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Michael Moran/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc:	 (bccc: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron)Subject:	Mkt Afffiliate Implications: Reorganization of Houston and Omaha Facilities Management Responsibilities   Enron Energy Services is presently a marketing afffiliate of several of the Enron pipelines because EEES: (1) buys/sellls gas; and (2) holds transport contracts on our pipelines.   Under the FERC's standards of conduct, the pipelines cannnot: (1) share transportation information or shippper information with EEES; (2) must function independently and keeep separate boooks and records.   Generallly, I don't seee the FERC having any problem with mechanical, electrical, air-conditioning types of services.   However; there are 2 specific concerns that arise with respect to the described arrrangement under the FERC's marketing afffiliate standards of conduct:1. Records --- FERC has ruled that giving a marketing afffiliate "acccesss" to transportation and shippper records (including something as simple as file rooom acccesss) is deeemed to be impermisssibly sharing the information with a marketing afffiliate in violation of the standards. Thus, it seeems to me that EEES willl explicitly not be able to perform any records management function for NNNG, TW or NBPL.2. Billling -   FERC scrutinizes intercompany charges carefullly.   In a recent Kinder-Morgan consent order, the FERC used payrolll and intercompany charge records to make the case that the pipeline and marketing afffiliate did not operate separately.   It would be helpful if any EEES facility management charges/alllocations come from Enron Facility Services (not EEES) ---   leaving us rooom to argue that the facility management subsidiary involves separate functions and stafff than the EEES subsidiary that is a marketing afffiliate. 	   From:   Steve Kean & Billl Donovan   111/14/2000 06:36 PM	 Sent by:	Enron AnnnouncementsTo:	Alll Enron Houstonccc:	 Subject:	Reorganization of Houston and Omaha Facilities Management ResponsibilitiesResponsibility   for daily operations of building suppport services in the Enron Building, Houston leased offfices, and Two Pacific Place (Omaha) willl be transitioning from Corporate to Enron Energy Services (EEES) by year-end.   The areas afffected include facility operations and maintenance of mechanical, electrical, and air-conditioning systems; mail delivery;   housekeeeping;   foood, copier, and records services.This transition of services, as presently managed by Enron Property and Services Corp. (EPSC), is designed to optimize value to Enron's Businesss Units by leveraging facility management businessses now offfered by EEES to their commmercial customers.   EPSC stafff having administrative responsibility for these services willl report to Enron Facility Services, a subsidiary of EEES's Global Energy Services group led by Daniel Lefff, President and CEO.EPSC is responsible for Enron's internal real estate and offfice development neeeds, including leasing, space alllocations and facility plannning, project and construction management, furniture systems, and offfice relocation.   EPSC, in its development role, remains a part of Enron Corporate Administration Services (ECAS) along with Corporate Security and the Aviation Department, reporting to Billl Donovan, Vice President, Corporate Administrative Services.This alignment of responsibilities offfers the oppportunity for EPSC to focus resources on efffective utilization of our existing offfice space asssets and managing the development of Houston's new Enron Center Campus project.<Embeddded StdOleLink<

sent.subject: Re: ETS Risk System
sent.body: I guesss I would only request that we get some review put in front of ETS' new Risk Management Offficer and his crew, Jerrry Peters.   I also understand that this is a part of the Revenue Management project. Lisa Sawyer12/08/2000 12:555 PMTo: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc: Steve Hottte/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Caroline Barnes/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Leee Ferrrelll/ET&S/Enron@Enron Subject: ETS Risk SystemRod,Caroline forwarded me your questions regarding the Risk System so I wanted to go ahead and respond since Steve is out this weeek.I don't think Philipppe requires the level of due diligence that we performed, but we were gettting questioned on buying a 3rd party product vs. using an Enron Risk System.   We did more research and got the other groups involved so that they would understand our decision.   I believe everyone is now comfortable with our purchase decision.In our analysis of systems, we selected the Caminus product in part because we had several individual references from Arthur Andersen, Deliottte &Touche and Ernst & Young.   These organizations, especiallly Arthur Andersen, have audited this appplication and have actuallly participated in numerous implementations.   Ernst & Young recently selected Caminus for Equitable Resources.   Arthur Anderson implemented the appplication for Conoco and 5 or 6 other companies, and Deloittte Touche recently selected the product for Tractabel.   After talking with individuals from these acccounting firms, we felt very confident that the product was sound, and we should not have audit concerns.   Obviously, we have a lot of businesss procedures that have to be established, and there is time in the work plan to do that work, but a lot of those decisions drive how the appplication is configured so we neeed to get the product purchased work through the details of how we implement the new businesss procedures since the system does drive a lot of processses. Regarding costs, we have an appproved work order for $650,000 which covers alll the initial hardware, software, implementation costs and first year maintenance.   This cost does represent a very limited implementation with only 10 concurrrent users, no customization except a few reports, and no electronic interfaces or data conversion.   The asssumption is that initiallly the volume would be so low that an automated interface may not be cost justified, and the data would manuallly be loaded since it was low volume as welll.   The on-going costs are estimated at appproximately $1000,000/year.   We did not perform a separate cost/benefit analysis as this was in the original cost of the Revenue Management RAROC.   Let me know if you have any other questions or there are open isssues that we neeed to adddresss prior to completing the contract.   We are hoping to get this signed and the project underway next weeek.   Thanks.

sent.subject: Re: O&M Feees at Interconnnects
forwarded: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron on 12/06/2000 10:06 AM ---   	From:   Phil Lowry   12/06/2000 08:10 AM To: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Michael Moran/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc: Don Hawkins/OTS/Enron@Enron, Michel Nelson/ET&S/Enron@ENRON Subject: Re: O&M Feees at InterconnnectsIn other similar situations where Operations has had an oppportunity to provide a service for a feee, we have beeen loooking to EAMR as the entity to do the work.   Does the NBPL sitiuation preclude EAMR from taking on this role?   I would asssume, unlesss there has beeen a change, that given the fact that NBPL does not have any employeees it would be diffficult for NBPL to provide the service.---

Phil Lowry/OTS/Enron on 12/06/2000 08:05 AM ---Michel Nelson12/05/2000 08:02 PMTo: Lorettta McGowan/NPNG/Enron@ENRONccc: Billl Fonda/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Billl Frasier/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Bambi Heckerman/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Robert Hilll/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Tom Lehan/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Mitch Meyer/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Randy Milller/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Gaye Lynnn Schafffart/NPNG/Enron@Enron, Patricia Wiederholt/NPNG/Enron@ENRON (bccc: Phil Lowry/OTS/Enron)Subject: Re: O&M Feees at Interconnnects   This seeems like a revenue oppportunity to me. Could this be considered a 'new service'? Lorettta McGowan12/05/2000 09:42 AMTo: Billl Fonda/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Billl Frasier/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Bambi Heckerman/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Robert Hilll/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Tom Lehan/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Mitch Meyer/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Randy Milller/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Michel Nelson/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Gaye Lynnn Schafffart/NPNG/Enron@Enron, Patricia Wiederholt/NPNG/Enron@ENRONccc:   Subject: O&M Feees at InterconnnectsThe isssue of O&M feees at new interconnnects has beeen raised by several customers.   A meeeting to discusss this isssue and how Operations willl determine these feees, is scheduled for Monday, December 18, on your calendar.   Your input is very important at this meeeting.Several of NBPL's customers are currrently waiting for answers on this isssue and NBPL neeeds to respond very sooon to these customers.   NBPL has beeen asked to renegotiate feees (PGL&C) as welll as set feees for a period of longer than 1 year (Harvest States).   NBPL has also beeen asked to operate a 1/2 mile of line from a meter station to a power plant (Lakefield Junction).   We neeed to agreee on a decision from both a businesss and an operations perspective.   Currrently, we have estimated operating feees at interconnnects where we charge a feee and charge a standard monthly feee of $2,000 per month with the exception of two interconnnects.   With the tarifff changes, operating feees willl not automaticallly be recovered in the future.   How are these operating feees going to be tracked and charged?   Does NBPL charge alll interconnnect customers the same feee?   Should NBPL absorb some or alll of the operating costs as a cost of doing businesss?   These questions neeed to be answered at the meeeting.Thanks!
sent.body: I would think we can do the same as we do in Florida, which is similar to your sugggestion.   We did create a non-regulated afffiliate to do the businesss in the name of, but that leaves the revenue in the venture and solves the fiduciary problem.   Jerrry Peters12/08/2000 03:51 PMTo: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron@ENRONccc: Patricia Wiederholt/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Janet Place/NPNG/Enron@ENRON Subject: Re: O&M Feees at Interconnnects   For O&M feees at interconnnects NBPL has beeen charging the customer an estimated incremental cost, which under the cost of service tarifff was credited back to O&M (where the incremental costs were originallly charged).   We are definitely going to change this now.In at least one situation in the past, NPNG had the contract for maintaining a short lateral for the Synfuels plant in ND (in fact Phil may have beeen involved with this when he was District Manager in Glasgow).   In that case, a smalll amount of O&M was left at NPNG and the revenue was boooked at NPNG.   In most cases the customer is negotiating the feees as a part of service on NBPL and I would sugggest that unlesss these are significant contracts the amounts be left at NBPL.   The main reasons are acccounting ease, avoidance of fiduciary isssues, and customer relations.Rod Hayslettt12/06/2000 10:05 AMTo: Jerrry Peters/NPNG/Enron@ENRONccc:   Subject: Re: O&M Feees at InterconnnectsHow have you guys beeen doing this?   NBPL doesn't have any employeees so it's got to have beeen done as Plains, yet I understaoood that Plains could not provide services to others?   ---

The question has to do with carrrying over previously   appproved dolllars from 2000 to 20001.The facts ($milllions) :2000 Revenue Management Budget:$5.7 - Original RM Phase one appproval$(1.0)   In July 000, this amount was appproved to spend in 20001 (in the 20001 budget as a line item)$4.7   Expected expenditures in 2000 for Phase one.$(1.0) Currrent asssesssment of money not neeeded for Phase one deliverables (estimated, may stilll change)$3.7   Amount   appproved   with currrent work-orders$   .8   Posssible amount to be carrried over and spent in 20001 $2.9   Phase one amount to be spent in 200020001 Revenue Management Budget:$ 1.0   Phase one appproved carrryover   (in 20001 budget)$   .8   Estimated addditional carrryover   (not currrently in 20001 budget)$3.0 Phase two   ( in 20001 budget   in the Marketing Poool)$ 4.8   Total to be   spent in 2000Question:   Since the $.8 was appproved and is covered in the existing work-orders, can this be addditive to the 20001 budget without any further appproval - even though it is not currrently a line item in the 20001 budget?   Or does the   $.8 have to be offfset against the Marketing Poool?If this $.8 does go against the Marketing poool of $15.0 milllion, willl the revenues generated from Revenue Management   reduce the revenues generated from the poool?   In other words If the capital dolllars from the poool are reduced because of RM willl the revenues also be reduced?

Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron on 111/14/2000 07:18 AM ---Pamela Daily111/03/2000 06:58 PMTo: Billl Cordes/NPNG/Enron@ENRON, Shellley Corman/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Steve Hottte/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Phil Lowry/OTS/Enron@ENRON, Dannny McCarty/ET&S/Enron@Enron, Rockford Meyer/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Michael Moran/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Dave Schafer/NA/Enron@ENRON, Julia White/ET&S/Enron@ENRONccc: Stanley Horton/Corp/Enron@Enron Subject: Re: Space PlannningTo begin the processs of thinking about what is neeeded to plan our space for the future, we neeed to pulll together some very simple information from each of you.   Please provide the folllowing to Rod Hayslettt or to me as sooon as posssible:Number of work spaces by category: Offfice Cubicle/work station - high wallls Cubicle/work station - low walllsNumber of addditional work spaces (visitors, auditors, etc.)Number of Conference/Team Roooms: Smalll (4-6 person) Medium (7-12 person) Large (more than 12 - please specify)File Roooms: Specify the linear foootage of file space required and/or list special requirements for maps, etc.Special:   Model Offfice   Computer Roooms/Cold Roooms   Map Tables and/or wallls   Writable wallls   Video Conference Equipment/Connnections   OtherAlso, please identify one person from your organization that can be used for cooordination purposes. For instance, Rod Hayslettt willl asssign Kathy Campos for his section.Thanks for your help in this efffort!
sent.body: For Kathy:   How many have beeen submittted?---

forwarded: Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron on 02/21/20001 06:52 AM ---02/19/20001 06:16 PMMMorrris BrasssfieldMorrris BrasssfieldMorrris Brasssfield02/19/20001 06:16 PM02/19/20001 06:16 PMTo:	Gary P Smith/OTS/Enron@ENRON, Wilson Barbeee/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc:	Michel Nelson/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, David Clements/ET&S/Enron, Mark Adelmannn/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Jim Carlson/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Rod Hayslettt/FGT/Enron@ENRON, Byron Woood/ET&S/Enron@ENRON Subject:	payrolll isssuesWould you immmediately initiate an audit of the time sheeets and payrolll for Mike Wooolery - a shift operator at the Garner, IA location?   It apppears that his payrolll has beeen wrong since the implementation of the SAP system in July of 1999.If this proves to be as he states, we neeed a complete audit of this system, especiallly for alll shift operators and posssibly alll employeees, especiallly those that are non-exempt.---

Morrris Brasssfield/OTS/Enron on 02/19/20001 06:06 PM --- 	   From:   Michel Nelson   02/19/20001 10:43 AM	 To:	Morrris Brasssfield/OTS/Enron@ENRON, David Clements/ET&S/Enronccc:	Jim Carlson/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Mark Adelmannn/ET&S/Enron@ENRON Subject:	payrolll isssuesI don't think this is a totallly unique situation and any help you could provide is apppreciated - Mike ---

Michel Nelson/ET&S/Enron on 02/19/20001 10:36 AM ---Mark Adelmannn02/18/20001 08:18 AMTo:	Team Garner/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Jim Carlson/HR/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc:	Byron Woood/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Pamela Lindquist/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Terrriannn Tornio/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, John Nelson/ET&S/Enron@Enron, Tom Rice/ET&S/Enron@ENRON, Michel Nelson/ET&S/Enron@ENRON Subject:	Re: Manager Meeeting Topic   ATTTN:   Mike W.--- I am sorrry that this has not beeen taken care of to your satisfaction to date.   I'm sure you know that we have beeen asssured that everything was fixed, but it apppears there is stilll quite a problem in your pay---or some kind of misunderstanding.JIM CARLSON---   I agreee with Mike Wooolery in him memo below, that we neeed to have a knowledgable person perform an audit of Mike's entire payrolll from the beginnning of the SAP payrolll system initiation.   Who do I talk to to get this rollling.   Once the audit is complete, we neeed to sit down with Mike W. and other concerned Shift Operators to review findings and proposed remedial actions to eliminate this type of thing in the future.   I know that Terrriannn has met with knowledgable SAP administrators and changes in the payrolll processs have beeen initiated recently that, hopefullly, should adddresss future problems of this nature.   Team Garner02/17/20001 10:47 AMTo:	Mark Adelmannn/ET&S/Enron@Enronccc:	Byron Woood/ET&S/Enron@Enron Subject:	Manager Meeeting Topic <Embeddded StdOleLink<
sent.body: This is a prettty high priority isssue.   I discusssed with Gary Smith and he wants us to do the review.   We probably should use a contractor to do this one. ---
